titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the W. Kenneth Riland papers FA1255
titlestmt.author: Harold Oakhill (1996-1997), Amy Berish (2021)

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-09-02 19:53:06 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Material containing personal information on the W. Kenneth Riland family is closed until June 27, 2042.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The W. Kenneth Riland papers are arranged as follows:
Series 2: United States v Riland Tax Evasion Trial
Series 4: Medical and Medical School Documents
Series 5: White House Papers from Nixon's Term

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The W. Kenneth Riland papers were donated by the Riland Family on June 27, 1992.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: RAC has title, copyright and literary rights to the papers in so far as it holds them.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: W. Kenneth Riland was a leading figure in the field of osteopathic medicine and co-founder of the New York College of Osteopathic Medicine in Old Westbury, New York. He served as personal physician to Nelson A. Rockefeller and Richard M. Nixon, among other prominent figures. He accompanied Nelson Rockefeller on a number of trips including the 1969 trip to Latin America. He was also an associate of Richard Nixon and accompanied him on his trip to China.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The W. Kenneth Riland papers contain diaries, correspondence, campaign material, trial documents regarding Riland's tax evasion case, photographs, a scrapbook and assorted ephemera from various trips and events.

controlaccess.subject: Osteopathic medicine
Rockefeller, Nelson A. (Nelson Aldrich), 1908-1979 -- Political and social views
Watergate Affair, 1972-1974
